definition: Sochi (city on the Black Sea in Russia)
surname Suo/abbr. for 索馬里|索马里[Suo3 ma3 li3], Somalia
to search/to demand/to ask/to exact/large rope/isolated
to carve/carved words/to agree/a contract/a deed

sentences.english: Clouds and showers soon returned to Sochi, and the Black Sea returned to its seasonally typical tempestuous ways.
sentences.chinese: 雲和雨回到索契，黑海恢復季節性的洶湧。

sentences.english: In public opinion polls, some 80% of Russians supported Sochi's candidacy.
sentences.chinese: 民調顯示，大約80%的俄羅斯人支持索契申奧。

sentences.english: President Bush will confer with President Putin in the Black Sea resort town of Sochi.
sentences.chinese: 布什總統將在黑海渡假勝地的索契市與普京總統會談。

sentences.english: Russia unveiled its mascots for the 2014 Winter Olympics on Saturday.
sentences.chinese: 上週六，索契冬奧會吉祥物經俄羅斯全國投票決出。

sentences.english: It is expected to be ready in time for the 2014 Winter Olympics in nearby Sochi.
sentences.chinese: 預計它將在毗鄰的索契舉辦2014年冬奧會前建成。

definition: Yekaterinburg (Russian city, also known as Ekaterinburg or Sverdlovsk)
Kaliningrad, town on Baltic now in Russian republic/formerly Königsberg, capital of East Prussia
Volgograd, Russian city on the Volga River 伏爾加河|伏尔加河[Fu2 er3 jia1 He2]
Khabarovsk, far eastern Russian city and province on the border with Heilongjiang province of China
pinyin: Ha1 ba1 luo2 fu1 si1 ke4

definition: Pingchang county in Panzhihua 攀枝花[Pan1 zhi1 hua1], south Sichuan
